title: Ideal Body Weight and Adjusted Body Weight
description: Calculates ideal body weight using the Devine formula and adjusted body weight for clinical use, particularly medication dosing and physiological calculations

parameters.name: actual_weight_kg
parameters.description: Patient's actual body weight in kg (optional, needed for adjusted body weight calculation)

result.name: body_weights
result.description: Calculated ideal body weight and adjusted body weight if actual weight provided

ranges.interpretation: Standard Devine formula applies for ideal body weight calculation
Consider subtracting 2-5 lbs per inch below 60 inches from calculated ideal body weight

references: Devine BJ. Gentamicin therapy. Drug Intell Clin Pharm. 1974;8:650-655
Pai MP, Paloucek FP. The origin of the "ideal" body weight equations. Ann Pharmacother. 2000 Sep;34(9):1066-9. doi: 10.1345/aph.19381
formula: Men: IBW = 50 kg + 2.3 kg × (height in inches - 60). Women: IBW = 45.5 kg + 2.3 kg × (height in inches - 60). Adjusted Body Weight = IBW + 0.4 × (actual weight - IBW)
notes: Primarily developed for medication dosing calculations
Generally applicable for people ≥60 inches (5 feet) tall
For patients under 5 feet, consider subtracting 2-5 lbs for each inch below 60 inches
Adjusted body weight is useful for overweight/obese patients
Confirm medication dosing recommendations with pharmacy
Some medications use ideal body weight, others use actual body weight
Only an approximation - clinical judgment should be applied
Useful for calculating tidal volume in mechanical ventilation
Widely used in critical care, emergency medicine, and pulmonology
